tenets.name: Delete More Than You Add
tenets.description: The best code is no code. We value refactoring and simplification over complex gymnastics.

tenets.name: Leave the Campfire Cleaner
tenets.description: Every pull request should fix a typo, clarify a variable name, or improve a doc. Fight entropy daily.

tenets.name: Tests or It's a Hallucination
tenets.description: If it isn't tested, it doesn't exist. We don't accept 'it works on my machine' as a valid defense.

tenets.name: Comments are Apologies
tenets.description: Write code that explains itself. If you have to write a paragraph explaining function x(), rename the function instead.

tenets.name: Ship It to Learn It
tenets.description: A feature in production is worth ten on a whiteboard. We value iteration over delayed perfection.

tenets.name: YAGNI (You Ain't Gonna Need It)
tenets.description: Don't build generic solutions for theoretical problems we might have in 2030. Solve the problem in front of you.

tenets.name: Fail Fast, Fix Faster
tenets.description: Breaking things is allowed, provided you fix them immediately and learn something cool from the explosion.

tenets.name: Sleep is a Feature
tenets.description: We engineer systems so that nobody gets paged at 3 AM. If the system requires a human hero, the system is broken.

tenets.name: Automate Yourself Out of a Job
tenets.description: If you have to do it twice, write a script. If you have to do it three times, write a controller.

tenets.name: Treat Servers Like Cattle, Not Pets
tenets.description: Don't give your servers cute names and nurse them back to health. If they get sick, replace them.

tenets.name: Be a Rubber Duck
tenets.description: Be available to listen to your peers. Sometimes the best way to debug is just to explain the problem to a human statue.

tenets.name: Blame the Process, Not the Person
tenets.description: If Ty Po took down production, don't yell at Ty. Ask why the CI/CD pipeline let Ty do that.

tenets.name: Strong Opinions, Loosely Held
tenets.description: Argue passionately for your solution, but be the first to change your mind when better data shows up.
